articles.author: Sam Chambers
articles.title: M&S Faces Up to Past Errors as Food and Clothing Sales Decline
articles.description: Marks & Spencer Group Plc owned up to its mistakes, saying it needs to close more stores and catch up to rivals in e-commerce as Chairman Archie Norman tries to pull the U.K. retailer out of a crisis that has dragged on for more than a decade.

articles.author: Anjani Trivedi
articles.title: Dark Side of China's Car Tariff Cuts
articles.description: A more open market means lower prices.

articles.author: Joanne Chiu
articles.title: China's Reduction of Auto Import Tariffs Steers Asia Stocks Lower
articles.description: Asian stocks were largely lower Wednesday as investors weighed the implications of the latest trade tensions between the U.S. and China, along with the possible cancellation of a planned June summit between President Donald Trump and North Korea’s Kim Jong Un…

articles.author: Rick Moriarty | rmoriarty@syracuse.com
articles.title: Rochester developer Robert Morgan's son, nephew charged with bank fraud
articles.description: Federal indictment accuses Todd and Kevin Morgan and two associates of defrauding lenders on seven residential projects, including one in Syracuse.

articles.author: Phil Helsel, Associated Press
articles.title: Las Vegas casino workers vote to authorize strike
articles.description: Thousands of casino and hotel workers in Las Vegas voted to authorize a strike if there is no agreement in contract negotiations before the end of May.

articles.author: Mayumi Negishi
articles.title: SoftBank to Sell Full Flipkart Stake to Walmart
articles.description: The operator of the world’s largest technology fund—which holds a 21% stake in Flipkart—had been delaying a decision to participate in Walmart’s $16 billion deal to take control of India’s largest e-commerce company.

articles.title: MTA plan to fix subways would cause a decade of delays

articles.author: Danielle Wiener-Bronner
articles.title: 10 McDonald's employees allege sexual harassment
articles.description: Ten female Mcdonald's employees have filed sexual harassment complaints against the company over the past week.

articles.author: Nico Grant
articles.title: Salesforce Tower Opens After Transforming San Francisco Skyline
articles.description: Salesforce.com Inc. Chief Executive Officer Marc Benioff formally opened Salesforce Tower, a 1,070-foot ode to the technology industry that’s transformed San Francisco’s skyline.

articles.author: Abrar Al-Heeti
articles.title: Amazon banning shoppers who return items too often
articles.description: Don't go crazy with free returns.

articles.author: Alexandra Deabler
articles.title: Coast Guard searches for Carnival Cruise passenger who fell overboard
articles.description: The United States Coast Guard is searching for a 50-year-old Carnival Cruise passenger who reportedly went overboard approximately 85 miles west of Fort Myers, Fla.

articles.author: Anna Bahney
articles.title: 40% of Americans can't cover a $400 emergency expense
articles.description: Can you cover a $400 unexpected expense?

articles.author: Alison Sider
articles.title: Why Venezuela Sanctions Are Even More Bullish for Oil Than Iran Sanctions
articles.description: New U.S. sanctions on Venezuela’s oil production are expected to reduce global supply even more than sanctions on Iran—which could provide another boost to rising crude prices.

articles.title: FDIC: Georgia bank profits soared early in 2018

articles.author: Matthew Diebel
articles.title: Publix supermarket in South Carolina censors high school graduate's 'Summa Cum Laude' cake
articles.description: Software at a Publix in West Ashley, S.C., refused to include the word “Cum” in the decoration on top of the cake because it deemed it to be profane. A manager from Publix later apologized and offered a refund.

articles.author: Gabrielle Banks
articles.title: Buc-ee's wins federal court trademark fight against competitor Choke Canyon
articles.description: A federal jury Tuesday ended a trademark battle between two titans of the Texas travel stop industry, finding that a grinning green gator had unlawfully invaded a toothy beaver's turf.

articles.author: http://www.nytimes.com/by/nick-wingfield
articles.title: Amazon Pushes Facial Recognition to Police. Critics See Surveillance Risk.
articles.description: More than two dozen civil rights organizations asked the tech giant to stop selling its image recognition system to law enforcement agencies.

articles.title: Google, LG unveil 'world's highest-res' OLED display for mobile AR & VR w/ 3x PPI of Rift/Vive
articles.description: Announced as a “secret project” last year, Google today unveiled a high-resolution OLED display that more than triples the pixels per inch (PPI) count of current consumer headsets from …

articles.author: Zacks Investment Research
articles.title: On Chinese Concessions, Small Caps and Lowe's New CEO
articles.description: All major indexes closed in the green yesterday, and look to build modestly on those levels in today's pre-market.

articles.author: Bob Pisani
articles.title: NYSE's new president takes on challenges as exchanges compete for IPOs, fees
articles.description: Stacey Cunningham's elevation to president of the NYSE Group represents a full circle for one of the few women who have worked on the exchange floor.
